text: A fresco painted by Sergei Fyodorov in 2004 in the north transept of the Rochester cathedral, depicting the Baptism of Christ and that of the men of Kent. Sergei Fyodorov (, alternative English spelling Sergey Fedorov), born in Moscow, Russia in 1969, is a Russian icon painter. Fyodorov studied in Moscow art school. He worked at Danilov monastery together with father Zenon (Зинон or Теодор), the famous Russian icon painter. For many years he lived and worked in the UK. His major works in England include icons at Westminster Abbey, Winchester Cathedral also an icon for the shrine of Saint Richard at Chichester Cathedral and a fresco in Rochester Cathedral.Campbell-Johnson. Chichester Cathedral: The Shrine of St Richard (Retroquire). pp.16-18 Other works include iconostasis of Church of Christ's Ascension at Nikitskaya ("Smaller Ascension", Церковь "Малое Вознесение") and Russian Orthodox church in Bauska, Latvia.
